text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to highlight that an individual claiming actual occupation must have a right in the land. The candidate answer addresses this by stating that to have legal protection as a tenant, the user typically needs a tenancy agreement and payment of rent. It explicitly mentions that without paying rent and a formal agreement, the user likely has minimal legal protection and might be classified as an 'excluded occupier' or licensee, which implies a lack of a recognized legal right in the land sufficient to override the sale.", "criterion_id": "8718243c-5ff0-4b5c-8761-fc13dc640746"}
